***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /sɑː/, [s̪äː]
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
Ultimately from Sanskrit सम (sama).
*** Postposition[edit] ***
सा • (sā) (Urdu spelling سا‎)
   1. like, as
   2. resembling, alike
   3. -ish, -esque
            वह बड़ा सा आदमी है। ― vah baṛā sā ādmī hai. ― He is like a big man.
            वो हरा सा है। ― vo harā sā hai. ― It is greenish.
** Usage notes[edit] **
The semblative particle is equivalent to the semblative_case found in some
languages.
** Declension[edit] **
Declension of सा (ā-stem)

                            singular plural singular plural
                   direct   सा       से     सी       सी
                            sā       se     sī       sī
                   oblique  से       से     सी       सी
                            se       se     sī       sī
                   vocative से       से     सी       सी
                            se       se     sī       sī
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
*** Noun[edit] ***
सा • (sā) m
   1. (music) the first note of the Indian solfege – षड्ज (ṣaḍj)

**** Adjective[edit] ****
सा
   1. Devanagari_script form of sā, which is feminine nominative singular of त
      (ta, “that”)
**** Pronoun[edit] ****
सा
   1. Devanagari_script form of sā, which is nominative singular of ता (tā,
      “she, it”)
**** Noun[edit] ****
सा
   1. Devanagari_script form of sā, which is inflection of सन्:
         1. nominative singular
         2. nominative/vocative plural (san, “dog”)
***** Sanskrit[edit] *****
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
*** Noun[edit] ***
सा • (sā) f
   1. name of Lakshmi or Gauri
** Declension[edit] **
Feminine ā-stem declension of सा
Nom. sg.     सा (sā)
Gen. sg.     सायाः (sāyāḥ)
             Singular       Dual               Plural
Nominative   सा (sā)        से (se)            साः (sāḥ)
Vocative     से (se)        से (se)            साः (sāḥ)
Accusative   साम् (sām)     से (se)            साः (sāḥ)

Locative     सायाम् (sāyām) सयोः (sayoḥ)       सासु (sāsu)
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
Weak form of the root सनति (sanati, “to procure, bestow, give, distribute”).
*** Adjective[edit] ***
सा • (sā) f
   1. giving, bestowing, granting (usually at the end of a compound)
            अप्सा (ap-sā) — giving water
            अश्वसा (aśva-sā) — gaining or procuring horses
**** Etymology 3[edit] ****
From Proto-Indo-European *séh₂. Compare also masculine and neuter forms स (sá),
तद् (tád).
*** Pronoun[edit] ***
सा • (sā́) f
   1. (3rd person pronoun) she
